Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) Path Analysis

Source: R/sem.R
run_sem.Rd

Fit structural equation models with latent and observed variables using lavaan. Provides publication-ready output for path analysis, mediation models, and confirmatory factor analysis with multiple outcomes.

Usage

run_sem(
  model,
  data,
  estimator = "ML",
  se = c("standard", "bootstrap", "robust"),
  bootstrap = 5000,
  missing = c("listwise", "fiml"),
  std_estimates = TRUE,
  fit_measures = c("chisq", "df", "pvalue", "cfi", "tli", "rmsea", "rmsea.ci.lower",
    "rmsea.ci.upper", "srmr"),
  seed = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

model

Lavaan model syntax (character string) or list of equations. See lavaan::model.syntax for details. Can use simplified syntax: c("y ~ x + m", "m ~ x") or full lavaan syntax with latent variables.

data

Data frame containing all variables in the model.

estimator

Estimator to use. Default is "ML" (maximum likelihood). Options: "ML", "MLM" (robust), "MLR" (robust), "ULS", "DWLS", "WLS".

se

Standard error method. Default is "standard". Use "bootstrap" for bootstrap standard errors (recommended for indirect effects).

bootstrap

Number of bootstrap samples if se = "bootstrap". Minimum 1000, 5000+ recommended for publication.

missing

How to handle missing data. Default is "listwise" (complete cases). Use "fiml" for full information maximum likelihood (only with ML estimator).

std_estimates

Logical. If TRUE (default), returns standardized estimates in addition to unstandardized.

fit_measures

Character vector of fit indices to include. Default is c("chisq", "df", "pvalue", "cfi", "tli", "rmsea", "srmr"). See lavaan::fitMeasures for all available options.

seed

Random seed for reproducibility (used with bootstrap).

...

Additional arguments passed to lavaan::sem().

Value

Object of class sem_result (extends lavaan object) with additional elements:

params

Tibble of parameter estimates with CIs

fit

Tibble of model fit indices

r2

Tibble of R^2 for endogenous variables

indirect_effects

Tibble of indirect effects (if present)

model_syntax

Original model specification

interpretation

Publication-ready interpretation text

lavaan_fit

Original lavaan fit object

Details

This function provides a simplified interface to lavaan::sem() with sensible defaults for consumer psychology research. It automatically:

  • Validates model syntax and data

  • Calculates standardized and unstandardized estimates

  • Extracts fit indices following JCP 2026 guidelines

  • Identifies and extracts indirect effects

  • Generates publication-ready interpretation

  • Handles bootstrap CIs for indirect effects

**Model Syntax**:

  • Regression: y ~ x + z

  • Latent variable: latent =~ indicator1 + indicator2

  • Covariance: x ~~ y

  • Indirect effect (labeled): y ~ b*m; m ~ a*x; ab := a*b

**Fit Index Guidelines (Hu & Bentler, 1999)**:

  • CFI >= 0.95 (good), >= 0.90 (acceptable)

  • TLI >= 0.95 (good), >= 0.90 (acceptable)

  • RMSEA <= 0.06 (good), <= 0.08 (acceptable)

  • SRMR <= 0.08 (good), <= 0.10 (acceptable)

References

Rosseel, Y. (2012). lavaan: An R package for structural equation modeling. Journal of Statistical Software, 48(2), 1-36.

Hu, L., & Bentler, P. M. (1999). Cutoff criteria for fit indexes in covariance structure analysis. Structural Equation Modeling, 6(1), 1-55.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Simple mediation model
model <- "
  # Direct effects
  satisfaction ~ b*quality + c*price
  quality ~ a*brand_reputation

  # Indirect effect
  indirect := a * b
"

result <- run_sem(model, data = consumer_survey, se = "bootstrap",
                  bootstrap = 5000, seed = 123)
print(result)

# Path model with multiple outcomes
model2 <- c(
  "purchase_intent ~ attitude + subjective_norm",
  "attitude ~ ad_exposure + prior_belief",
  "subjective_norm ~ ad_exposure"
)

result2 <- run_sem(model2, data = mydata)
tidy_sem(result2)
} # }
